dublinCore.dc:title: 118 HR 1548 RH: Improving Access to Small Business Information Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mrs. Kim of California (for herself and Mr. Gottheimer) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Financial Services, and in addition to the Committee on Oversight and Accountability, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned
Reported from the Committee on Financial Services with an amendment
action.action-instruction: Strike out all after the enacting clause and insert the part printed in italic

action.action-desc: Committee on Oversight and Accountability discharged; committed to the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the Union and ordered to be printed
action.action-instruction: For text of introduced bill, see copy of bill as introduced on March 10, 2023

form.official-title: To amend the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 to specify that actions of the Advocate for Small Business Capital Formation are not a collection of information under the Paperwork Reduction Act.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Improving Access to Small Business Information Act.

section.header: Exclusion from the Paperwork Reduction Act
section.text: Section 4(j) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 (15 U.S.C. 78d(j)) is amended by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.header: Exclusion from the Paperwork Reduction Act
paragraph.text: Actions taken by the Advocate for Small Business Capital Formation under this subsection shall not be a collection of information for purposes of subchapter I of chapter 35 of title 44, United States Code (commonly known as the Paperwork Reduction Act).

endorsement.action-desc: Reported from the Committee on Financial Services with an amendment
Committee on Oversight and Accountability discharged; committed to the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the Union and ordered to be printed
